study_plan_entry.title: Empirical methods in management and finance research

free_text.Learning outcomes: 1. Create innovative thinking in the area of corporate finance, capital markets and financial intermediation.[br/]	2. Help students in their research in the field.[br/]	3. Discuss recent contributions in empirical literature in finance and management; evaluate critically the actual vaiue added by these papers.
free_text.Content: This course covers recent research and advances in corporate finance and financial institutions. The objective of the course is to introduce Ph.D. students with the foundations of corporate finance and financial intermediation with some of the latest research in these areas. Special emphasis will be placed on research that has been conducted on new ventures, security designs, bank efficiency, and M&A. The course should be of particular interest for students who are currently pursuing doctoral studies at the junction of finance, economics, and technology management or related fields.  In addition, it should appeal to all students in the business fields who are interested to learn how theory can be linked with empirical questions and implementations.
